speech.words: Greetings Treasure Hunters!  I am
Sigmund Petticoat
The world famous, incredibly intelligent and surprisingly handsome sea captain!
We are on the hunt for the lost city of Abydos.
It was the first Capital city of the Egyption civilisation.
I have found a scroll which holds vital information that will take us to the city!
And of course plenty of fame too!
The only problem is that it is written in Coptic - an ancient language that they used in Egypt
Luckily I know just the person to help us on this quest who can translate the text.
All we need to do is convince them to join!
But first!
We have a long and arduous journey ahead of us
We will need some provisions
Firstly we have a purse of coins,
should we need to grease some palms and give some bribes along the way
Secondly we need something to sustain us.
Should we take water to drink or food to eat
Marvelous, you chose |value:and|
Stick it in your bag and we will shout when we need it.
But just in time, I can see our expert
Alexandria Catchpole
arriving now.  Greetings Alexandria
Good day, Sigmund!
What luck and good fortune it is that you are in Cairo today.  We need someone with your expertise and knowledge to assist us on our hunt for
The Long lost city of Abydos
That is very flattering, but you see I have some things that I need to do.  And they are quite important
Why should I go? With you?
Typical Alexandria.  Brain the size of an elephant.
But she has always been very stubborn
We need to convince her.  Shall we try and tempt her with the promise of gold and fame?
Or shall we appeal to her knowledge and tempt her with the prospect of something new?
I could become famous and rich you say?
yes
I do have quite a lot to do
but alright, you have got me.

I can't wait until I have more money and people love me.  And the first thing I'll do is run straight over to my sister's house and pull down my trousers and wiggle my new, brand new, gold plated pants un her face!
Take that. I say
Now anyway.  Back to these instructions.  Yes, yes I see.
Oh how very odd!
How unexpected!
Do you think you could share with us?
Oh yes.  Of course.
These instructions tell us to head to the Nile.  Where we must cross.
Well the Nile is only a few minutes down this road.  I am very much looking forward to all the things I might buy.
Gold plated dinner plates?
Gold plated watch?
Gold plated shoes?
Gold plated toothbrush?
Gold plated everything
I do love to discover and learn and to explore.
yes
I do have quite a lot to do
but alright, you have got me.
I can't wait to discover the secrets that live beneath the surface.
I've been wondering what to write my next book about.  Perhaps this place will hold my next big story.
Now anyway.  Back to these instructions.  Yes, yes I see.
Oh how very odd!
How unexpected!
Do you think you could share with us?
Oh yes.  Of course.
These instructions tell us to head to the Nile.  Where we must cross.
Well the Nile is only a few minutes down this road.  I wonder what we are going to find?
A pharoah?
Some mummies?
A pyramid?
Valuable and exotic artefacts?
I can't wait
Right.  The instructions say that we must cross the Nile here, and then head North.  So off we go everyone
Hold on just one second!  This doesn't look terribly safe.  The river is very wide and deep and fast flowing.  I think we should look for another place to cross!
But who knows how far the next crossing is?  And we'd only need to double back on ourselves anyway.  We should definitely cross here.  I have been in trickier situations before
I really don't know
Fine.  We will ask the rest of the team.
Do you think we should walk miles and miles and miles and miles in the boiling hot sun to then walk miles and miles and miles and miles back, just so we can cross somewhere a little safer
Or shall we cross here and get that treasure as quickly as possible?
Against my better senses we decide to cross the Nile here.

As we cross the treacherous waters we really have to heave and pull ourselves against the strong current trying to pull us down stream. The water gets deeper and we find our feet can only just touch the bottom of the riverbed. Soon we are swimming and struggling to keep going
Come on.  It's not, that, bad.
Suddenly a huge log comes charging down the river at us. We have no choice but to jump out of it's way
But this sends us tumbling and churning down the river and as we fight and fight to stay afloat we get more and more tired. Eventually passing out asleep.
When we wake we are soaking wet and spluttering for air. We feel very lucky that we have escaped that terrifying ordeal. We hear a high pitched and annoying sound.
Three seagulls have landed next to us.  They are aggressively pestering us for food.
Has anyone got any food on them?
Good decision team! I didn’t like the look of those waters at all.
We begin to trudge up river, South.
What time is it?
At midday we are still walking and there is no end in sight. We are getting hotter and hotter still, Alexandria has turned a very deep shade of red
Why did you idiots have to choose this ridiculous path!? What time is it!?
At 1PM the heat becomes too hot to bear.  Luckily a tribesman finds a tree for us to hide under. Through heat exhaustion we all fall deeply into a sleep.
When we awaken we find three giraffes standing proudly above us. They look hungry. They start munching at the leaves above our heads.
Within a few seconds the blistering sun starts to shine down on us again.

Since we picked to carry water not food we have nothing to offer the seagulls. Annoyed that we haven't helped them, the seagulls go for the next best option, a precious looking sheet of instructions and then fly off. I'm afraid we have failed our mission and will have to make another decision.

Since you all decided to bring food with us we have something to distract the seagulls with. Reluctantly we offer up the food that we saved for our journey and the seagulls fly away leaving us in peace. Alexandria studies the instructions again.
Since you chose to bring food we try and tempt the giraffes to eat that instead.

But the giraffes turn their noses up. For these giraffes, only leaves are on the menu. Without clean water and without shelter we all soon succumb to dehydration, and die. We have failed our mission and will have to make another decision
Ha. Hah.  I have cracked it
Cracked what?
There is another route to the lost city. And given our detour this is definitely much quicker now. This journey will take us straight through the heart of a dark, ancient forest.
Dark. Ancient Forest.  That sounds a little scary
Don’t be ridiculous Sigmund. It’ll just be like a walk in the park.

Since you chose to bring water we have nothing to distract the giraffes with. They chomp and munch, and bite and crunch until all of the protection above us has been removed. We find ourselves becoming weak and wobbly as the heat takes its toll. But thankfully because we brought our water we are able to stay just cool enough until the harsh heat of the middle of the day passes. We continue our journey until we reach another river crossing.
Following Alexandria’s instructions we hike towards the forest. It is a hard walk, and after what we have just been through it feels very unfair. It feels like there is no end in sight. Until.
Up ahead! Can you see it?

See what? But before Alex can even answer we all clap eyes on exactly what Alexandria was talking about. A giant, sprawling, dark, ancient forest. It is so dense it looks as though even the wind wouldn’t escape it’s tight grip.
See! A walk in the park!
I do not want to go in there. But I suppose we don’t have any choice. So on we trudge.
I tell you what’ll raise your spirits. Let’s have a quick game of eye spy. I’ll go first. I spy with my little eye, something beginning with...
S. D.
Is it Scary Darkness?
No, you silly goat! It’s Sand Dune! Here’s another, I spy with my little eye, something beginning with... Oh wait. I can’t see anything.
I think we’re going to need your help everyone. Can you use your bodies to create something that you might see out here in the desert? Maybe an animal, maybe something in the sky, on the ground?
Ah that's much better. I can spy a |value:,|
I have one. I spy with my little eye, something beginning with
H. A. B.
H.A.B.
I don't know, what is it?
Hot. Air. Baloon.
No  you can't see that
Yes I can.  And it looks like it is landing just over there.  Let's go and say hello!
You can all go ahead. I will be waiting just here for you to come back.
When we get to the Hot Air Balloon we are all shocked at the size of it. The Balloon billows in the wind, and it is so colourful. What colours can we see in the balloon?
The balloon is |value:and|.
Suddenly a short old face appears from the basket and shouts over to us.
Oi! Who goes there? What do you want with looking at my ship?
Terribly sorry. We are treasure hunters you see and were really interested by your Balloon.
Well, ok. That may be, but I’m a very busy person and if you don’t mind I’ll be off.
Where are you going to?
Just the other side of the woods
Really?  That’s just where we are going too. Would you have space for us to join along?
Yes. But it’ll cost you. One purse of coin and I’ll bring you to the other side of the woods. But no coin, and no flight. You’ve got 5 minutes to decide.

Wow. What a stroke of luck. I know Alexandria would say walk through the forest, but I’m really really scared of that place. What do you think we should do? Walk through the forest and keep our coin? Or pay the pilot to fly us over the forest - it’ll be much quicker too.
You drive a hard bargain, but it’s a deal. Here is our purse of coin. Come on everyone, climb aboard. And can you give Alexandria a shout for us to come on over too.
Thank you for your offer, but our coin is far more important than getting a safe ride across the forest. We are going to take our chances.
Fair enough. But mind out for the pools, they are very deep and you don’t see them coming! Bye!

What a peculiar person. Probably for the best that we didn’t get in their balloon after all. Let’s go and find Alexandria again and make a move. It’ll be getting dark before too long if we don’t get a wriggle on. Several miles further and we find ourselves at the entrance of the forest. The air smelt stale and warm.
The instructions are very clear. We must stay on the path. Never leave it or you’ll be trapped here forever.
That all sounds very reassuring.
Following the path we make steady progress into the forest. Either side of the path we see deep pools of water.
Like the Pilot warned us about. We really must keep our eyes peeled.

With no visibility of the Sun we all lose track of time in the woods. We could have been in here for minutes, hours or even days. But I know just the thing to keep our spirits up. Who can give us another letter for eyespy. What can you see?
Alright.  No need to shout.  I'm coming!

Aboard the hot air balloon we all felt exhilerated. Our blood was pumping and our hearts racing. We were having the time of our lives - apart from Alexandria. Turns out Alex is scared of heights. Don’t worry - I told him it was just like a walk in the park.
That's not funny!
As we float over the forest we see that it is thick, tangled and easy to get lost in. We also see deep pools of water that look like death traps. I say that you have all made a very good decision.
Are we nearly landed yet?

Not long left. I tell you what. Why don’t we try and distract Alexandria by playing her favourite game. Using your bodies, can you create something that we might be able to see up here in the clouds? Maybe it’s something up here? Maybe you can see it on the ground? Or in the distance? Come on, what can you see?
Oh no. Alexandria. Look around.
Whaaat?
Look where we are? Or rather aren’t? We have lost the path.
Oh come now, it can’t be that bad. Let’s just retrace our steps a little.
Which direction did we come from?
That way. Or was it this? Maybe there?
Face it, we’re lost.
But suddenly that became the least of our worries. The ground beneath us started to tremble and wobble.
Then as if it were a hungry beast opening its mouth to swallow us down we fell straight through it.

We all land with an almighty splash. We look up and find out that we have fallen into one of the deep pools in the forest. With no hope of rescue or escape, we eventually perish and die. We have failed our Mission.
Are we nearly there yet?
Yes! Everyone brace yourselves, it might be a bumby landing.
Oh no! I don’t want to die!!!
It’s okay Alex. We’ve landed. We’re safe. Now what do the instructions say now?

Well if my understanding is correct, we should travel one more mile East from here and that should be the centre of the lost city. But there are some hieroglyphs, they are pictures that Egyptians used instead of letters - that I don’t recognise. Hopefully all will make sense soon.
